name: cause
trans: n. 原因；事业；目标 vt. 引起；使遭受

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: independent
trans: adj. 独立的；单独的；无党派的；不受约束的 n. 独立自主者；无党派者

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: respect
trans: n. 尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意 vt. 尊敬，尊重；遵守

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: bridle
trans: n. 缰绳；马勒；系带；约束物 vt. 控制；给装马勒 vi. 昂首表示轻蔑；生气 n. (Bridle)人名；(英)布赖德尔

sentences.english: The metal mouthpiece of a bridle, serving to control, curb, and direct an animal.
sentences.chinese: 马勒， 嚼子放在嘴里的金属制马勒，用于控制约束和驾御牲畜。

sentences.english: Inadvertently the paper added a comma to the ad, which read instead:Horse, saddle and bridle for $50.
sentences.chinese: 无意中报纸在广告语中加了个逗号，读起来成这样了，50元卖马，马鞍和马缰绳。

sentences.english: These included a saddle, bridle, clay vase, wooden bowl, trough, iron kettle, the remains of an entire horse, and ancient clothing.
sentences.chinese: 这些物品包括一个鞍，缰绳，黏土花瓶，木碗，饲料槽，铁壶，一整匹马的遗骸以及一件古老的衣服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上笼头； 昂首 ； 抑制
detailed_translations.english: to put a bridle on a horse
a set of leather bands put around a horse’s head and used to control its movements

name: flutter
trans: v. 飘动；（鸟或昆虫）鼓翼；飞来飞去；（心脏等）怦怦乱跳；（人）奔忙 n. 振动；（非正式）小赌注；紧张兴奋；（心脏的）怦怦乱跳；扑动；（重放录音的）颤振

sentences.english: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 枯叶缓缓飘落到地上。

sentences.english: The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘动。

detailed_translations.english: to make small gentle movements in the air

name: gauge
trans: n. 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格 vt. 测量；估计；给…定规格

sentences.english: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计量器；标准尺寸；容量规格
detailed_translations.english: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something
to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

name: parafoil
trans: n. 翼伞

name: shock
trans: n. 休克；震惊；震动；打击；禾束堆 vt. 使休克；使震惊；使震动；使受电击；把…堆成禾束堆 vi. 感到震惊；受到震动；堆成禾束堆 adj. 浓密的；蓬乱的 n. (Shock)人名；(英)肖克

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

name: train
trans: n. 火车；行列；长队；裙裾 v. 培养；训练；瞄准 n. (Train)人名；(英)特雷恩；(法)特兰；(意)特拉因

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

name: camel
trans: n. [畜牧][脊椎] 骆驼；打捞浮筒；工作作风官僚 adj. 驼色的；暗棕色的 vi. 工作刻板平庸 n. (Camel)人名；(法)卡梅尔；(阿拉伯)卡迈勒

sentences.english: The favorite, of course, is camel.
sentences.chinese: 最受欢迎的自然是驼色。

sentences.english: I wonder what the ECL on a half-camel is.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道半骆驼的有效人物等级是多少。

sentences.english: Earth tones are definitely big for this season, and camel will fit in with trends such as Queen's Country, Town meets Country and the like seamlessly.
sentences.chinese: 大地色无疑是这一季的主打，驼色也非常适合“王室风范”“大都市遭遇乡村风尚”这些流行系列，并且配合得天衣无缝。

detailed_translations.english: a large desert animal with a long neck and either one or two  hump s (= large raised parts )  on its back

name: elephant
trans: n. 象；大号图画纸

sentences.english: A trunk distinguishes the elephant.
sentences.chinese: 长鼻是象的特征。

sentences.english: So the part of the elephant I experience applies what we know about people and how we apply that to UX design.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我体验的那部分的大象就是我们对人的了解和我们将我们的了解应用于用户体验设计。

sentences.english: Tom: No.Although 75% of its raw materials is elephant dung, it is light delicate fragrance instead of stink. This is due to its special fabrication technology.
sentences.chinese: 不，尽管这种纸里75％的原料都是大象的粪便，但它不但不臭，反而有一种淡淡的清香，这是源于它的特殊的制造工艺。

detailed_translations.english: a very large grey animal with four legs, two tusks(= long curved teeth ) and a trunk(= long nose ) that it can use to pick things up

name: elk
trans: n. 麋鹿；软鞣粗皮；驼鹿皮革 n. (Elk)人名；(芬)埃尔克

sentences.english: I covered the elk with a tarp and sat down near it, wrapping myself in blankets.
sentences.chinese: 我用一块防水布盖住了麋鹿，然后用毯子把自己裹起来，坐在它旁边。

sentences.english: When the elk got up, the tarp slid off.
sentences.chinese: 麋鹿站起来的时候，防水布从它身上滑落。

detailed_translations.english: a very large brown North American, European, and Asian animal with wide flat horns

name: fox
trans: n. 狐狸；狡猾的人；狐皮；狐狸精，性感的女子 v. 使猜不透；欺骗，使迷惑；耍狡猾手段 n. (Fox)（英、美、德、丹、爱）福克斯（人名）

sentences.english: We were foxed by the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们被这个问题难住了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse or deceive someone in a clever way
a wild animal like a dog with reddish-brown fur, a pointed face, and a thick tail

name: giraffe
trans: n. 长颈鹿

sentences.english: I/ you/ we/ they like giraffe.
sentences.chinese: 我/你/我们/他们喜欢长颈鹿。

sentences.english: So they sent me a … giraffe!
sentences.chinese: 于是他们又送我一只…长颈鹿。

sentences.english: Can I get the mommy giraffe for Christmas?
sentences.chinese: 我在圣诞节能得到一个长颈鹿妈妈吗？

detailed_translations.english: a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs and dark spots on its yellow-brown fur

name: hippopotamus
trans: n. [脊椎] 河马

sentences.english: Still, now we knew for sure where whales came from and that the hippopotamus theory wasn't complete science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 虽然，我们现在已肯定知道鲸来自何处，但是我们也清楚了，河马之说还不够完整。

sentences.english: Only two-and-a-half weeks old but already weighing in at 40kg (88lb) a baby hippopotamus swims alongside her mother, Kathi.
sentences.chinese: 这只有两周半大却重达40公斤（88磅）的河马宝宝正游曳在妈妈凯瑟琳旁边。

sentences.english: We were walking along the bank of the Niger river, searching for the tracks of a hippopotamus that was ravaging the corn on Karim's farm.
sentences.chinese: 当时，我们正走在尼日尔的河岸上，寻找着毁坏克莱姆村农场农作物的罪魁祸手河马的踪迹。

detailed_translations.english: a large grey African animal with a big head and mouth that lives near water

name: kangaroo
trans: n. 袋鼠

sentences.english: The kangaroo has a problem.
sentences.chinese: 这只袋鼠有一个难题。

sentences.english: This is the kangaroo from Australia.
sentences.chinese: 这是一只来自澳洲的袋鼠。

sentences.english: Thanks to special bacteria in their stomachs, kangaroo flatulence contains no methane and scientists want to transfer that bacteria to cattle and sheep who emit large quantities of the harmful gas.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠胃中有一种特殊的细菌能使其放的屁中不含有甲烷。 科学家想将这种细菌移至牛羊的胃中，以抑制它们所排放的大量有害气体。

detailed_translations.english: an Australian animal that moves by jumping and carries its babies in a pouch (= a special pocket of skin ) on its stomach

name: zebra
trans: n. [脊椎] 斑马 adj. 有斑纹的 （Zebra）斑马（文具品牌）；斑马公司（指盈利性和有责任感的公司）

sentences.english: The neck of the zebra was nipped by a lion.
sentences.chinese: 狮子咬断了那头斑马的脖子。

sentences.english: But what if your horse suddenly grows zebra stripes?
sentences.chinese: 可是如果那匹马突然长出了斑马的条纹呢？

sentences.english: Sixty acres of woods and ponds are home to camels, zebra, bison, water buffalo, ostrich and antelope.
sentences.chinese: 六十英亩的森林和池塘是骆驼，斑马，野牛，水牛，鸵鸟和羚羊的家园。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a horse but has black and white lines all over its body

name: breeze
trans: n. 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波 vi. 吹微风；逃走 n. (Breeze)人名；(法)布雷兹

sentences.english: flowers waving in the breeze
sentences.chinese: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

detailed_translations.chinese: 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波
detailed_translations.english: a gentle wind

name: cupcake
trans: n. 纸托蛋糕；杯形蛋糕

name: magic
trans: n. 魔法，巫术；魔术；魅力；（非正式）有魅力之物；（非正式）罕见才能 adj. 有魔力的；魔法的；神奇的；（非正式）极好的 v. （像）用魔法变出（或移动、改变等） n. (Magic) （美）马吉克（人名）

sentences.english: a book of magic spells
sentences.chinese: 一本关于魔法的书

sentences.english: a magic sword
sentences.chinese: 一把魔剑

detailed_translations.english: in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things
the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions

name: picnic
trans: n. 野餐 vi. 去野餐

sentences.english: We decided to have a picnic down by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定在湖边野餐。

sentences.english: a picnic table
sentences.chinese: 野餐桌

sentences.english: There is free parking for visitors, as well as a restaurant and picnic area (= a special area with tables where people can have a picnic ) .
sentences.chinese: 除了餐厅和野餐区，我们还为游客提供免费停车位。

sentences.english: The area is very popular with picnickers.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区很受野餐者的欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a picnic, you take food and eat it outdoors, especially in the country
to have a picnic

name: swirl
trans: v. 盘绕，打旋；使成漩涡；流传；眩晕 n. 漩涡；打旋；涡状形

sentences.english: ...small swirls of chocolate cream.
sentences.chinese: …小块旋涡形的奶油夹心巧克力。

detailed_translations.english: a swirling movement or amount of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 盘绕；打旋；眩晕；大口喝酒
detailed_translations.english: to move around quickly in a twisting circular movement, or to make something do this

name: weather
trans: n. 天气；气象；气候；处境 vt. 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打 vi. 风化；受侵蚀；经受风雨 adj. 露天的；迎风的 n. (Weather)人名；(英)韦瑟

sentences.english: What’s the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 今天天气如何？

sentences.english: The weather turned bitterly cold.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很冷了。

detailed_translations.english: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind

detailed_translations.chinese: 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: elect
trans: v. 选举；选择，决定（做某事）；（上帝）挑选（某人）（使其灵魂永远得救） adj. 卓越的；蒙上帝挑选（而得救）的；当选（而尚未就职的） n. 被选的人；上帝的选民；特权集体

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: government
trans: n. 政府；政体；管辖

sentences.english: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。

sentences.english: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。

sentences.english: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
sentences.chinese: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

sentences.english: strong government
sentences.chinese: 强有力的统治

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who govern a country or state

name: lawyer
trans: n. 律师；法学家 n. (Lawyer)人名；(英)劳耶

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: message
trans: n. 消息；差使；启示；预言；广告词 vi. 报信，报告；[通信] 报文 vt. 通知

sentences.english: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.english: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。

sentences.english: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across (= communicate what you want to say ) without being so angry.
sentences.chinese: 就算不这么生气，你也完全可以把意思说清楚。

sentences.english: They use illustrations to convey their message.
sentences.chinese: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

detailed_translations.english: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc

name: speech
trans: n. 演讲；讲话；[语] 语音；演说

sentences.english: He has to make a lot of after-dinner speeches .
sentences.chinese: 他经常要发表席后演说。

sentences.english: Collins gave the keynote speech (= most important speech ) .
sentences.chinese: 科林斯作了主题发言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲；讲话；[语] 语音；演说
detailed_translations.english: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people

name: attack
trans: n. 攻击；抨击；疾病发作 vt. 攻击；抨击；动手干 vi. 攻击；腐蚀 n. (Attack)人名；(瑞典)阿塔克

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: capture
trans: vt. 俘获；夺得；捕捉，拍摄，录制 n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: crew
trans: n. 队，组；全体人员，全体船员 vi. 一起工作 vt. 使当船员 n. (Crew)人名；(英、西)克鲁

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.english: a crew member
sentences.chinese: 一名机组人员

detailed_translations.english: all the people who work on a ship or plane

name: pirate
trans: n. 海盗，海上劫掠者；盗版者，侵犯专利权者；非法制作电视或广播节目的人（或组织）；道德败坏者，违法者 v. 盗印，窃用；劫掠（船只）；劫掠（船只） adj. 盗版的

sentences.english: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；盗版；侵犯专利权者
detailed_translations.english: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program

name: sail
trans: vi. 航行；启航，开船 n. 帆，篷；航行 vt. 航行

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.english: The trawler had sailed from the port of Zeebrugge.
sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

name: treasure
trans: n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品 vt. 珍爱；珍藏 n. (Treasure)（英、美、爱）特雷热（人名）

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery

name: bounce

sentences.english: The men jumped to their feet and saluted.

detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…敬礼，向…致意；赞扬，颂扬
detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc
an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer

name: tracing
trans: v. 找到；追溯；追踪；沿……走；描绘；画（线）；勾画出（轮廓）；描摹；研究……的历史（trace 的现在分词） n. 摹图；淡淡的痕迹；冰上划痕；痕迹；追踪时留下的复制档案

name: alike
trans: adj. 相似的；相像的 adv. 十分相像地，很相似地；两者都，同样地；同等对待地，一视同仁地 n. (Alike) （印、美）艾立凯（人名）

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

name: collection
trans: n. 采集，聚集；[税收] 征收；收藏品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: hobby
trans: n. 嗜好；业余爱好 n. (Hobby)人名；(英)霍比

sentences.english: What are your hobbies?
sentences.chinese: 你有些什么爱好？

sentences.english: Susan’s hobbies include reading, cooking, and drama.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊的业余爱好包括阅读、烹饪和戏剧。

sentences.english: Retirement gave him the time to pursue his hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 退休以后他有充裕的时间来做自己喜欢做的事。

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

name: keepsake
trans: n. 纪念品

sentences.english: But most of us hold on to at least one keepsake to remind us of our once-grand passions.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们中的大多数人至少会保留一件纪念品，以此来纪念我们曾经伟大的爱情。

sentences.english: This carpet was found in Japan, probably once a keepsake of a Japanese soldier after a Yuan naval invasion was repulsed.
sentences.chinese: 这小块地毯式在日本发现的，可能是一个日本士兵曾在抵抗元朝海军入侵得到的一件纪念品。

sentences.english: Whether your goal is to create a stepping stone or some other form of keepsake related to your pet, creating a paw print mold is a way to personalize a one-of-a-kind item.
sentences.chinese: 不管你的目标是要制作一个台阶的垫脚石还是要制作一个其他形式的有关你的宠物的纪念品，制作爪子印模型都是一个一流个性化的主意。

detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep to remind you of someone

name: popular
trans: adj. 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: type
trans: n. 类型，品种；模范；样式 vt. 打字；测定（血等）类型 vi. 打字 n. (Type)人名；(英)泰普

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

name: burner
trans: n. 燃烧器；火炉；[化工] 燃烧炉；灯头 n. (Burner)人名；(法)比尔内；(德)布尔纳

detailed_translations.english: one of the round parts on the top of a cooker that produce heat

name: fuel
trans: n. 燃料；刺激因素；（为身体提供能量的）食物 vt. 给……提供燃料；刺激，煽动；推动 vi. 得到燃料 n. (Fuel) （美）傅爱乐（人名）

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

name: nylon
trans: n. 尼龙，[纺] 聚酰胺纤维；尼龙袜

sentences.english: nylon fabric
sentences.chinese: 尼龙织物

sentences.english: The tent was made of nylon.
sentences.chinese: 那顶帐篷是尼龙做的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尼龙，[纺] 聚酰胺纤维；尼龙袜
detailed_translations.english: a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc

name: oxygen
trans: n. [化学] 氧气，[化学] 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: satellite
trans: n. 卫星；人造卫星；随从；卫星国家

sentences.english: the launch of a communications and weather satellite
sentences.chinese: 气象通信卫星的发射

detailed_translations.english: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication

name: scenery
trans: n. 风景；景色；舞台布景

sentences.english: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
sentences.chinese: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

sentences.english: Instead of stagehands, the actors will move the scenery right in front of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 演员们将替代舞台工作人员，当着观众的面置换布景。

detailed_translations.english: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: elevated
trans: adj. 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的 v. 提高；抬起；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词） n. 高架铁路

sentences.english: elevated philosophical language
sentences.chinese: 充满智慧的哲学语言

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的
detailed_translations.english: elevated thoughts, words etc seem to be intelligent or of high moral standard

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高；抬起；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词）

name: fountain
trans: n. 喷泉，泉水；源泉 n. (Fountain)人名；(英)方丹

sentences.english: The fountain wells its cold water.
sentences.chinese: 喷泉涌出清凉的泉水。

sentences.english: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

detailed_translations.english: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park

name: platform
trans: n. 平台；月台，站台；坛；讲台

sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: reflection
trans: n. 反射；沉思；映象

sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

trans: n. 电影院，戏院，剧场；戏剧；手术室

sentences.chinese: 它预示了新的戏剧旺季的来临。

sentences.english: The theater emptied when the movie ended.
sentences.chinese: 电影结束了， 剧院里的人就走空了。

sentences.english: You know, like fencing, or theater or something.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，像是击剑，戏剧表演或什么的。

name: discover
trans: vt. 发现；发觉 vi. 发现

sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

trans: n. 幻想；白日梦；幻觉 adj. 虚幻的 vt. 空想；想像 vi. 耽于幻想；奏幻想曲（等于phantasy）

sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: galaxy
trans: n. [天] 星系；银河系（the Galaxy）；一群显赫的人 n. 三星智能手机品牌 2015年三星中国公布Galaxy的中文名称为“盖乐世”（Galaxy） [ 复数galaxies ]

sentences.english: Astronomers have discovered a distant galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家们发现了一个遥远的星系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
detailed_translations.english: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: stew
trans: n. 炖煮的菜肴；焦虑，不安；（古）热浴室；妓院；鱼塘，大鱼桶；（非正式）乘务员；烦恼，闷热 v. （肉、水果等食物）炖，焖；（茶）（因久泡）变浓变苦；忧虑；受闷热；（诗/文）沉浸于 n. (Stew) （英、美、加、俄）斯图（人名）

sentences.english: stewed apples

name: vet
trans: n. 兽医；兽医诊所；老兵；审查 v. 审查，检查；作兽医；诊疗 n. (Vet) （荷，俄）韦特（人名）

sentences.english: All candidates are carefully vetted by Central Office.
sentences.chinese: 所有候选人都由总部仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to check someone’s past activities, relationships etc in order to make sure that person is suitable for a particular job, especially an important one

name: allergic
trans: adj. 对…过敏的；对…极讨厌的

sentences.english: an allergic reaction to nuts
sentences.chinese: 对坚果的过敏性反应

detailed_translations.english: having an allergy

name: allergy
trans: n. 过敏症；反感；厌恶

sentences.english: a food allergy
sentences.chinese: 食物过敏

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which you become ill or in which your skin becomes red and painful because you have eaten or touched a particular substance

name: ingredient
trans: n. 原料；要素；组成部分 adj. 构成组成部分的

sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: medicine
trans: n. 药；医学；内科；巫术 vt. 用药物治疗；给…用药

sentences.english: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
sentences.chinese: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。

sentences.english: She studied medicine at Johns Hopkins University.
sentences.chinese: 她曾在约翰•霍普金斯大学学医。

sentences.english: the remarkable achievements of modern medicine
sentences.chinese: 现代医学的非凡成就

detailed_translations.english: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink

name: peanut
trans: n. 花生

sentences.english: a packet of roasted peanuts
sentences.chinese: 一袋烤花生

detailed_translations.english: a pale brown nut in a thin shell which grows under the ground

name: wheeze
trans: v. 喘息；喘息地说出；气喘吁吁地走动；（器械）气喘似的响 n. 喘息声；（非正式）巧妙主意；（不再好笑的）过时笑话

sentences.chinese: 他胸部有严重问题，总是不停地气喘和咳嗽。

detailed_translations.english: If someone wheezes, they breathe with difficulty and make a whistling sound

name: desert
trans: n. 沙漠，荒原；沉闷乏味的境况（或地区），冷清的地方；应得的赏罚（常用复数） v. 遗弃；舍弃，离弃（某地方）；（士兵）擅离（部队）；逃走；开小差；放弃，撇下不管；背离，使失望；（感觉、品质或技艺）离开，丧失 adj. 沙漠的；荒凉的；被抛弃的

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand

name: festival
trans: n. 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐 adj. 节日的，喜庆的；快乐的

sentences.english: the Swansea Festival of Music and the Arts
sentences.chinese: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

sentences.english: Christmas is one of the main festivals in the Christian Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节是基督教历的重大节日之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔电影、戏剧、音乐等的〕节，节庆，会演；节日
detailed_translations.english: an occasion when there are performances of many films, plays, pieces of music etc, usually happening in the same place every year

trans: n. 鞭炮，爆竹

sentences.english: I played firecracker but I hurt my finger with the fire.
sentences.chinese: 在我玩爆竹的时候，伤着了我的手指。

sentences.chinese: 我们再次飞回来时，卡索科拉已经准备好了。 我们第一发爆竹炸弹径直射进了篝火中。

sentences.chinese: 市场开张庆典后的爆竹残渣,足以印证多数投资者的乐观情绪.

detailed_translations.english: a small  firework  that explodes loudly

name: Hindu
trans: adj. (Hindu) 印度的；印度教的 n. (Hindu) 印度人；印度教教徒 n. (Hindu) （印、美、英、俄、加）欣杜（人名）

sentences.english: ...a Hindu temple.
sentences.chinese: …一座印度教寺庙。

detailed_translations.english: Hindu is used to describe things that belong or relate to Hinduism
someone whose religion is Hinduism

name: mangrove
trans: n. 红树林

name: monsoon
trans: n. 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风

sentences.english: ...the end of the monsoon.
sentences.chinese: …雨季的结束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季风；（印度等地的）雨季；季候风
detailed_translations.english: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

name: cuckoo
trans: n. 布谷鸟；杜鹃鸟；傻子；咕咕声 adj. 愚笨的；疯狂的 vi. 学杜鹃叫 vt. 不停地重复

sentences.english: You’re completely cuckoo!
sentences.chinese: 你真是个傻子！

detailed_translations.chinese: 布谷鸟；杜鹃鸟；傻子；咕咕声
detailed_translations.english: a grey European bird that puts its eggs in other birds’  nests  and that makes a sound that sounds like its name
crazy or silly

name: sundial
trans: n. 日晷，日规；羽扇豆（产于美国东部）

sentences.english: The shadow on this sundial showed the time to the minute precisely!
sentences.chinese: 由这个日晷的阴影显示出来的时间，精确到了分钟。

sentences.english: The invention and use of the gnomon-and-ruler, sundial, clepsydra and other time-measuring machines is evidence of Chinese wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 圭表、日晷、漏刻等计时仪器的发明和应用，证明中华民族是个充满智慧的民族。

detailed_translations.english: an object used in the past for telling the time. The shadow of a pointed piece of metal shows the time and moves round as the sun moves.

name: carved
trans: adj. 有雕刻的 v. 雕刻（carve的过去式和过去分词）

name: curse
trans: n. 诅咒；咒骂 vt. 诅咒；咒骂 vi. 诅咒；咒骂

sentences.english: He believed that someone had put a curse on the house.
sentences.chinese: 他相信有人对这房子下了诅咒。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sentence used to ask God or a magical power to do something bad to someone or something

name: design
trans: n. 设计；构思；设计图样；装饰图案；打算 v. 设计，构思；计划；制造，意欲 n. (Design) （巴、印、俄）迪赛（人名）

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: display
trans: n. 显示；炫耀 vt. 显示；表现；陈列 vi. [动] 作炫耀行为 adj. 展览的；陈列用的

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: stingy
trans: adj. 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: condition

trans: adj. 被施魔法的 v. 使着魔（enchant的过去式）

trans: n. 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动 vi. 大怒，发怒；流行，风行 n. (Rage)人名；(丹)拉厄

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动

to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: weep
trans: v. 哭泣，流泪；哭着说；哀悼；渗出（液体） n. 哭泣，落泪

sentences.english: James broke down and wept.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯控制不住感情，哭了起来。

sentences.english: He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.
sentences.chinese: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

detailed_translations.english: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

name: wretched
trans: adj. 可怜的；卑鄙的；令人苦恼或难受的

sentences.english: the poor, wretched girl
sentences.chinese: 极其不幸的可怜姑娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: gangway
trans: n. 舷梯；跳板；进出通路；座间过道 int. 让路

detailed_translations.chinese: 跳板； 样板； 舷梯
detailed_translations.english: a large board or steps between a boat and the shore for people to walk down

name: hoist
trans: v. 升起，吊起；抬高，举起 n. 起重机；吊车；升降机；升起，增加；信号旗；旗宽 n. (Hoist) （美、印、英、加）霍伊斯特（人名）

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: trap
trans: n. （捕捉动物的）陷阱，捕捉器；圈套，伏击；牢笼，困境；双轮轻便马车；嘴；（赛狗开始时的）放狗隔栏；容器；抛靶器；（非正式）爵士乐手的打击乐器（常复数）；暗色岩 v. 使……陷入险境或困境；（衣服、身体部位）夹住，绊住；捕捉，收集；使陷入圈套，使上当；给马戴饰物；（足球）停球；储存（气体、水等） n. (Trap) （美、丹、法、荷）特拉普（人名）

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

name: czar
trans: n. （帝俄的）沙皇，皇帝；独裁者

name: mine
trans: n. 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷 vt. 开采，采掘；在…布雷 vi. 开矿，采矿；埋设地雷 pron. 我的 n. (Mine)人名；(德、塞、土、毛里塔)米内

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

name: peasant
trans: n. 农民；乡下人

sentences.english: Most villagers are peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 大多数村民是农民。

detailed_translations.english: a poor farmer who owns or rents a small amount of land, either in past times or in poor countries

name: president
trans: n. 总统；董事长；校长；主席

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

trans: vi. 搅拌；搅动 vt. 搅拌；搅动 n. 搅乳器

sentences.english: ...dirt roads now churned into mud by the annual rains.
sentences.chinese: …土路现在被一年一度的雨水搅和得一片泥泞。

a container used for shaking milk in order to make it into butter

name: disobey
trans: v. 违反；不服从

sentences.chinese: 你违抗我的命令。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to do what someone with authority tells you to do, or refuse to obey a rule or law

name: lowly
trans: adj. 卑贱的；地位低的；谦逊的

name: strum
trans: v. 弹奏（吉他等乐器）；漫不经心地弹拨 n. 弹拨声；一下弹奏 n. (Strum) （美）斯特鲁姆（人名）

name: barbecue
trans: n. 烤肉；吃烤肉的野宴 vt. 烧烤；烤肉

sentences.chinese: 除夕那天我们在海滩上举行了烧烤野餐。

sentences.english: barbecued chicken
sentences.chinese: 〔用烤架烧的〕烤鸡

to cook food on a metal frame over a fire outdoors

trans: n. 烟火（firework的复数形式）；激烈争论

sentences.chinese: 你还做了什么？-我在街上观看了烟花和舞龙。

sentences.english: Fireworks shows are popular around the world. But if I do not end this program right now, there will be fireworks from my producer.
sentences.chinese: 烟火盛会在全世界都受欢迎，但如果我不马上结束这期节目的话，我的制作人就要发火了。

name: parade

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

name: patriotic
trans: adj. 爱国的

sentences.chinese: 爱国歌曲

sentences.english: a patriotic man who served his country well

detailed_translations.english: having or expressing a great love of your country

trans: n. 探险家；勘探者；探测器；[医]探针

sentences.chinese: …哥伦布、麦哲伦和许多其他探险家的旅行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels through an unknown area to find out about it

name: frame

sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

sentences.chinese: …一个固定的三叶螺旋桨。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

sentences.chinese: 轮轴发涩, 该上油了。

sentences.chinese: 通过定义，第五个轮子，是成为一个四轮马车的前车轴上互相旋转的两个部分的一个轮子或一个轮子的一部分，而加上一个额外的辅助轮子，这样它就不会倾斜。

sentences.english: The lens screws onto the front of the camera.

sentences.chinese: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

sentences.chinese: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

sentences.chinese: 这场比赛通过卫星向全世界的观众进行了转播。

sentences.chinese: 配亮色衬衫的黑裤子

sentences.english: You can team up with one other class member if you want.
sentences.chinese: 例句：如果你愿意的话，可以找一个同学组成一组。

sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

trans: n. 脊骨，脊柱；支柱；骨气，毅力；书脊；（生化）聚合分子主链；（计算机）主干网

sentences.english: Farmers are the backbone of this community.
sentences.chinese: 农场主是这个团体的中坚力量。

name: venomous
trans: adj. 有毒的；恶毒的；分泌毒液的；怨恨的

sentences.chinese: 莉萨恶狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.english: Reid reserved his most venomous attack for the Rail Authority.
sentences.chinese: 里德攻击铁路当局还有最厉害的一招没使出来。

sentences.chinese: 他想带球晃过对方球员。

trans: adj. 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的 vt. 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害 vi. 犯规；腐烂；缠结 n. 犯规；缠绕 adv. 违反规则地，不正当地

sentences.chinese: 营中难民缺少食物，还面临水源污染的危险。

sentences.english: extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
sentences.chinese: 排出隧道污浊空气的排气扇

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害

name: goal
trans: n. 目标；球门，得分数；终点 vi. 攻门，射门得分

sentences.english: Your goal as a parent is to help your child become an independent adult.
sentences.chinese: 身为父母，你的目标就是要培养孩子成为独立的成年人。

sentences.english: I scored the first goal.
sentences.chinese: 我踢进了第一个球。

name: match
trans: n. 火柴；比赛，竞赛；对手；相配的人（或物）；（计算机）匹配；配合；搭配；相似的东西；婚姻；配偶 v. 相配，相称；相似；与……成对；配对；敌得过，比得上；使等同于；使……对应；满足；与……竞争；结婚

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

name: tie

sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

name: argue
trans: vi. 争论，辩论；提出理由 vt. 辩论，争论；证明；说服 n. (Argue)人名；(英、法)阿格

sentences.chinese: 我们听到邻居在争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way

name: cabin

sentences.english: a log cabin
sentences.chinese: 原木小屋

sentences.english: 英文例句He showed her to a small cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他把她带到一间小房舱。

sentences.english: He sat quietly in the first class cabin of the flight looking tired.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地坐在班机的头等舱内，看上去有些疲惫。

detailed_translations.english: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

name: canoe
trans: n. 独木舟；轻舟 vi. 乘独木舟 vt. 用独木舟运

sentences.english: The explorers paddled their canoe cautiously upstream.
sentences.chinese: 探险者们谨慎地把独木舟向上游划去。

sentences.english: At a summer job working as park naturalists that year, I flipped the canoe Air and I were paddling and we had to push it to shore.
sentences.chinese: 那年我在公园里做暑期兼职，我把独木舟翻转个身，然后我们一起合力将它推到岸边，这样我们就可以划船了。

sentences.english: I remember the first time I visited a village in Vietnam, in 1995: we endured hours and hours of rutty roads or long hours in a canoe to reach project sites.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1995年第一次访问越南一个村落，我们捱过很多小时的路途颠簸、坐了很多小时的独木舟，才到达项目的所在地。

detailed_translations.english: to travel by canoe
a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

name: paddle
trans: n. 划桨；明轮翼 vt. 拌；搅；用桨划 vi. 划桨；戏水；涉水

sentences.english: Each man had a paddle for an hour and then a rest.
sentences.chinese: 每人划一小时桨， 然后休息一下。

sentences.english: We strive to paddle to follow the stream, however, we are unsure if how and when we will reach the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着河流奋力划桨，但是我们无法确定我们什么时候和怎样才能到达地平线。

sentences.english: If you run your team as if they were self-leading, but in reality they’re chaos, then before long you’ll be heading up a certain creek without a paddle.
sentences.chinese: 如果你当他们是自我引导型的团队在运作，但其实他们事实上还是在混乱的状态，那么不久你就会在一条河上像没有桨似的乱窜。

detailed_translations.english: a short pole that is wide and flat at the end, used for moving a small boat in water
to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

name: stepsister
trans: n. （异父或异母生的）继姐，继妹

sentences.english: Yes. She is a friend of my stepsister. I know where she lives.
sentences.chinese: 真的。她是我同母异父（同父异母）姐姐的朋友。我还知道她住在哪里呢。

sentences.english: If you want I'll invite my stepsister and her to have dinner with us.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意的话，我会请我那个姐姐，还有她和我们一起吃晚饭。

detailed_translations.english: the daughter of your stepmother or stepfather

name: vacation
trans: n. 假期；（房屋）搬出 vi. 休假，度假

sentences.english: What will you do this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 你这个假期将干什么？

sentences.english: Do you have any vacation plans?
sentences.chinese: 您假期有什么安排吗？

sentences.english: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 这个假期你有什么想法吗？

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere for a holiday
a holiday, or time spent not working

name: cast
trans: vt. 投，抛；计算；浇铸；投射（光、影、视线等） n. 投掷，抛；铸件，[古生] 铸型；演员阵容；脱落物 vi. 投，抛垂钓鱼钩；计算，把几个数字加起来 n. (Cast)人名；(法)卡斯特

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

name: fetch
trans: vt. 取来；接来；到达；吸引 vi. 拿；取物；卖得 n. 取得；诡计

sentences.english: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅从浴室拿来一条毛巾。

sentences.english: Fetch me a glass of water.
sentences.chinese: 给我拿杯水来。

detailed_translations.english: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

name: pleading
trans: n. 恳求；答辩状 adj. 恳求的 v. 恳求；辩护；引证；承认（有罪或无罪）；以……为借口（plead 的现在分词）

name: snicker
trans: v. 偷笑，窃笑；（马）嘶鸣 n. 窃笑，吃吃地笑；马嘶声 n. (Snicker) （美、芬）斯尼克（人名）

sentences.english: We all snickered at Mrs. Swenson.
sentences.chinese: 我们都暗暗嘲笑斯温森太太。

sentences.english: ...a chorus of jeers and snickers.
sentences.chinese: ...一阵嗤笑。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh quietly and in a way that is not nice at something which is not supposed to be funny
Snicker is also a noun

name: sorcerer
trans: n. 魔术师；男巫士

name: celebration
trans: n. 庆典，庆祝会；庆祝；颂扬

sentences.english: the lively New Year celebrations in the city centre
sentences.chinese: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

detailed_translations.english: an occasion or party when you celebrate something

name: coast
trans: n. 海岸；滑行 v. 滑行；（交通工具）快速平稳地移动；得过且过，做事不费力；沿岸航行 v. (Coast) （英、美）科斯特（人名）

sentences.english: He pushed in the clutch and coasted to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 他踩下离合器，滑行了一会儿便停下来了。

detailed_translations.english: if a car or bicycle coasts, it moves without any effort from you or any power from the engine
the area where the land meets the sea

name: modern
trans: adj. 现代的，近代的；时髦的 n. 现代人；有思想的人

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

name: peak
trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌 vt. 使达到最高点；使竖起 vi. 消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴 adj. 最高的；最大值的 n. (Peak)人名；(英)皮克

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: capital
trans: n. 首都，省会；资金；大写字母；资本家 adj. 首都的；重要的；大写的 n. (Capital)人名；(法)卡皮塔尔

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: island
trans: n. 岛；岛屿；安全岛；岛状物 adj. 岛的 vt. 孤立；使成岛状 n. (Island)人名；(英)艾兰

sentences.english: I live on an island.
sentences.chinese: 我住在一个岛上。

sentences.english: Then one day, an English ship anchored near the island.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一天，一艘英国船在岛附近抛锚了。

sentences.english: This is because the island is so close to the equator. So you can choose to go whenever you like.
sentences.chinese: 就因为这个岛是如此接近赤道。所以只要你愿意你任何时候都可以去。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land completely surrounded by water

name: olive
trans: n. 橄榄；橄榄体；炖牛肉卷；油橄榄；橄榄树；橄榄绿；橄榄环；橄榄贝 adj. 橄榄绿的；（面色、肤色）黄棕色的 n. (Olive) （美）奥利芙（人名）

sentences.english: an olive grove
sentences.chinese: 一片橄榄树林

sentences.english: They are handsome with dark, shining hair, olive skin and fine brown eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他们很帅，有着乌黑闪亮的头发，黄褐色的皮肤，迷人的棕色眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: a small bitter egg-shaped black or green fruit, used as food and for making oil
If someone has olive skin, the colour of their skin is yellowish brown

name: attract
trans: vt. 吸引；引起 vi. 吸引；有吸引力

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: branch
trans: n. 分支；分公司；分部；树枝；支流；岔路；（血管）分枝 v. 发出新枝；岔开，分岔；出现分歧 n. (Branch) 布兰奇（人名）

sentences.english: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，满地都是大大小小的树枝。

sentences.english: The topmost branches were full of birds.
sentences.chinese: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

sentences.english: She now works in our Denver branch.
sentences.chinese: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。

sentences.english: a branch of mathematics/physics/biology etc
sentences.chinese: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

name: digest
trans: vt. 消化；吸收；融会贯通 vi. 消化 n. 文摘；摘要

sentences.english: Most babies can digest a wide range of food easily.
sentences.chinese: 大多数婴儿能轻易地消化很多种食物。

sentences.english: I struggled to digest the news.
sentences.chinese: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

sentences.english: a monthly news digest
sentences.chinese: 每月新闻摘要

detailed_translations.english: to change food that you have just eaten into substances that your body can use
a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

name: moisture
trans: n. 水分；湿度；潮湿；降雨量

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: parasite
trans: n. 寄生虫；食客

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼 vt. 种植；培养；栽培；安置 vi. 种植 n. (Plant)人名；(英、西、意)普兰特；(法)普朗

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: event
trans: n. 事件，大事；项目；结果

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: gymnast
trans: n. 体操运动员

sentences.english: Nora was an excellent gymnast in this country.
sentences.chinese: 诺拉是这个国家卓越的体操运动员。

sentences.english: I was 26 by then -- which is ancient for a male gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 我那时26岁，作为一名男子体操运动员已经太老了。

sentences.english: Ah, the perspective of the proud gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，自以为是的体操运动员的观点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at gymnastics and competes against other people in gymnastics competitions

name: marathon
trans: n. 马拉松赛跑；耐力的考验 adj. 马拉松式的；有耐力的 vi. 参加马拉松赛跑

sentences.english: the Boston Marathon
sentences.chinese: 波士顿马拉松赛

sentences.english: Garcia ran the marathon in just under three hours.
sentences.chinese: 加西亚用了不到三小时就跑完了马拉松。

detailed_translations.chinese: 马拉松赛跑；耐力的考验
detailed_translations.english: a long race of about 26 miles or 42 kilometres
a marathon event continues for a long time and needs a lot of energy, patience, or determination

name: stroke
trans: n. （游泳或划船的）划；中风；（打、击等的）一下；冲程；（成功的）举动；尝试；轻抚 vt. （用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘 vi. 击球；作尾桨手，指挥划桨；（打字时）击打键盘

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: fangs
trans: n. [脊椎] 尖牙；[脊椎] 毒牙（fang的复数）；物体的尖端 v. 用尖牙咬；配以尖牙般的东西（fang的三单形式）

name: harmless
trans: adj. 无害的；无恶意的

sentences.english: Her brother’s a bit simple, but he’s quite harmless.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟有点愚钝，不过他决不会伤害别人。

detailed_translations.english: unable or unlikely to hurt anyone or cause damage

name: prey
trans: n. 猎物；受害者，牺牲品；（情绪易受伤的）脆弱的人；掠夺品 v. 捕食；伤害；折磨，困扰 n. (Prey) （美、德、爱）普赖（人名）

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉，功能；观念；道理；理智 vt. 感觉到；检测 n. (Sense) （美）森斯（人名）

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: spider
trans: n. 蜘蛛；设圈套者；三脚架

sentences.english: Do you think that the spider can web anything?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这蜘蛛能用网捕住什么吗?

sentences.english: Why not hold spider of the week contests in your home throughout this season?
sentences.chinese: 在这整个蜘蛛出没的季节里，为什么不在你家里举行蜘蛛周竞赛？

sentences.english: Likewise, by these investigators’ logic, male arachnophobes should get a mild tickle down there whenever they spy a spider scurrying across their desk.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，按这些研究者的逻辑，男性蜘蛛恐惧者每次看到蜘蛛爬过桌子都应该下身瘙痒咯？

detailed_translations.english: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

name: venom
trans: n. 毒液；恶意 vt. 使有毒；放毒

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: equality
trans: n. 平等；相等；[数] 等式

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: judge
trans: n. 法官；裁判员；鉴定人 v. 判断；猜测（大小、数量等）；裁判；评价；审判，判决 n. (Judge) （美、爱、英）贾奇（人名）

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: flute
trans: n. 长笛；【工程设计】(刀具的)出屑槽 vt. 用长笛吹奏 vi. 吹长笛

sentences.english: The boy trilled on a flute.
sentences.chinese: 男孩在长笛上吹颤音。

sentences.english: He played a nice tune on the flute.
sentences.chinese: 他吹奏了一首优美的笛子曲。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

name: lemonade
trans: n. 柠檬水

sentences.english: a glass of lemonade
sentences.chinese: 一杯柠檬汽水

sentences.english: Would you like a lemonade?
sentences.chinese: 你要来一杯柠檬汽水吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sweet fizzy drink that tastes of lemons

name: prance
trans: v. 昂首阔步；（马）后足立地腾跃 n. 昂首阔步；（马）后足立地腾跃 n. (Prance) （美、英、加、澳）普兰斯（人名）

detailed_translations.english: to walk or dance with high steps or large movements, especially in a confident way

name: trapeze
trans: n. 秋千；吊架

detailed_translations.english: a short bar hanging from two ropes high above the ground, used by  acrobats

name: wail
trans: vi. 哀号；悲叹 vt. 为某人死亡而悲痛；哀悼某人；哀号着说 n. 哀号；悲叹；恸哭声 n. (Wail)人名；(阿拉伯)瓦伊勒；(英)韦尔

sentences.english: The women began to wail in mourning.
sentences.chinese: 女人们开始大放悲声。

sentences.english: Wails of grief were heard as visitors filed past the site of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 当来访者们列队走过灾难现场时听见阵阵悲痛的哀号声。

detailed_translations.english: If someone wails, they make long, loud, high-pitched cries which express sorrow or pain
Wail is also a noun

name: crooked
trans: adj. 弯曲的；歪的；不正当的

sentences.english: Your tie’s crooked.
sentences.chinese: 你的领带歪了。

sentences.english: narrow crooked streets
sentences.chinese: 狭窄曲折的街道

detailed_translations.english: bent, twisted, or not in a straight line

name: float
trans: v. 使漂浮，浮动；漂流，飘动；飘移；安排（贷款）提出，提请考虑（想法或计划）；发行（股票）上市；（货币汇率）自由浮动实行 n. （酒吧等用于给顾客找零的）备用零钱；彩车，花车；浮板；漂浮物；鱼漂；浮子；加冰激凌的饮料；浮动期；坐浮箱（治病、疗伤或放松）；救生圈 n. (Float)（美、英、德）弗洛特（人名）

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

name: patch
trans: n. 眼罩；斑点；碎片；小块土地 vt. 修补；解决；掩饰 vi. 打补丁 n. (Patch)人名；(英)帕奇

sentences.english: Look out for icy patches on the road.
sentences.chinese: 小心路上结冰的地方。

sentences.english: a cat with a white patch on its chest
sentences.chinese: 胸部有一块白斑的猫

sentences.english: He combs his hair over his bald patch .
sentences.chinese: 他把头发梳过来盖住秃掉的地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 眼罩；斑点；碎片；小块土地
detailed_translations.english: a small area of something that is different from the area around it
to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it

name: pumpkin
trans: n. 南瓜

sentences.english: pumpkin pie
sentences.chinese: 南瓜饼

detailed_translations.english: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

name: stream
trans: n. 溪流；流动；潮流；光线；（数据）流 vi. 流；涌进；飘扬 vt. 流出；涌出；使飘动

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

name: builder
trans: n. 建筑者；建立者

sentences.english: The builders have finished the roof.
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人们已经完成了屋顶的建造。

detailed_translations.english: a person or a company that builds or repairs buildings

name: cell
trans: n. 细胞；电池；蜂房的巢室；单人小室 vi. 住在牢房或小室中 n. (Cell)人名；(英)塞尔

sentences.english: cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 癌细胞

sentences.english: Embryos grow by cell division (= the splitting of cells ) .
sentences.chinese: 胚胎通过细胞分裂而成长。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

name: entrance
trans: n. 入口；进入 vt. 使出神，使入迷

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: protection
trans: n. 保护；防卫；护照

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: electricity
trans: n. 电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: energy
trans: n. [物] 能量；精力；活力；精神

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: generator
trans: n. 发电机；发生器；生产者

sentences.english: an emergency generator
sentences.chinese: 应急发电机

sentences.english: The company has been a very good cash generator.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是台非常出色的赚钱机器。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that produces electricity

name: natural gas
trans: [油气] 天然气

name: wildlife
trans: n. 野生动植物 adj. 野生动植物的

sentences.english: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
sentences.chinese: 保护该地区野生生物的措施

sentences.english: the destruction of wildlife habitats
sentences.chinese: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

detailed_translations.english: animals and plants growing in natural conditions
